name: Accordion
author: Total.js
readme: The Accordion is a vertically collapsible content panel which is displaying panels, one or multiple at a time within the available space.

name: Bar chart
author: Total.js
readme:
__Barchart data-source needs to contain__:

```js
[
	{
		name: 'name', // name of the serie
		data: [{ x: 'DATE', y: 'value' }, { x: 'DATE', y: 'value' }, ...], // series
		decimals: 2, // optional, number of decimal places
		unit: '°C' // optional
	}
]
```

name: Button
author: Total.js
readme:
# Button Component

The Button component allows you to customize various aspects of buttons in your web application. You can configure the following options:

- **Path:** Set the path for the button.
- **Font and Style:** Customize the font and style of the button.
- **Input:** Define the input settings for the button.
- **Name:** Specify the name or label for the button.

name: Calendar
author: Total.js
readme: The Calendar is a component which provides the multi-view representation to display and select a date. Also, provide options to navigate in different levels of views like month, year, decade.

name: Callout
author: Total.js
readme:
# Callout Component

The Callout component is a versatile element that allows you to create various callout messages in your web application. With this component, you can easily set the following properties:

- **Path:** Define the path or location for the callout.
- **Name:** Specify a name or label for the callout.
- **Icon:** Customize the icon associated with the callout.
- **Type:** Choose from different callout types: alert, error, message, and success.

name: Capture output
author: Total.js
readme: This component can capture data from an output.

name: Cards
author: Total.js
readme: With this component you can create interesting content. Most suitable on articles.

name: Checkbox
author: Total.js
readme: The component that switches between two states: `true`/`false`

name: Checkboxlist
author: Total.js
readme:
__Checkboxlist data-source needs to contain__:

```js
[
	{  id: 1, name: 'Ruby' },
	{  id: 2, name: 'PHP' },
	{  id: 3, name: 'node.js' },
	{  id: 4, name: 'Python', }
]
```

name: Color
author: Total.js
readme: The component allows selecting a color from the offered list.

name: Column chart
author: Total.js
readme:
__Columnchart data-source needs to contain__:

```js
[
	{
		name: 'name', // name of the serie
		data: [{ x: 'DATE', y: 'value' }, { x: 'DATE', y: 'value' }, ...], // series
		decimals: 2, // optional, number of decimal places
		unit: '°C' // optional
	}
]
```

name: Columns
author: Total.js
readme:
# Columns Component

The Columns component is a valuable tool for dividing and organizing your content into a specified number of parts within your web application. With this component, you can achieve the following:

- **Content Division:** Easily divide your content into a specific number of parts.
- **Settings:** Configure the number of parts to suit your content organization needs.

name: Comment
author: Total.js
readme: A simple component for writing comments.

name: Container
author: Total.js
readme: Container is a siple layout-component, where you can place your content.

name: Counter
author: Total.js
readme: This component keeps track of the count and increments it every time it receives a notify-event.

name: Data generator
author: Total.js
readme: Data generator creates data defined in the configuration.

name: Data reader
author: Total.js
readme: Data reader reads data from the URL address and stores them in memory. Other components can read this data.

name: Data source
author: Total.js
readme: This component displays data from specified datasource.

name: Data transformer
author: Total.js
readme: The data transform component can transform incoming data.

name: Data view
author: Total.js
readme: Data view reads data from predefined data views and stores them in memory. Other components can read this data.

name: DataGrid
author: Total.js
readme: This component displays data from your datasource in a grid. In settings you can set datasource, as well as style of grid columns.

name: Display
author: Total.js
readme: This component sets display sizes according to the current element width (as a class e.g. `d-xs` or `d-lg`). It can affect, for example, the Columns component.

name: Donut chart
author: Total.js
readme:
__Donutchart data-source needs to contain__:

```js
[
	{
		data: 44,
		name: 'Apple',
		unit: '',
		decimals: 1
	},
	{
		data: 55,
		name: 'Mango',
		unit: '',
		decimals: 1
	}
```

name: Dropdown
author: Total.js
readme:
__Dropdown data-source needs to contain__:

```js
[
	{ id: 1, name: 'Nothing' },
	{ id: 2, name: 'jComponent' },
	{ id: 3, name: 'Angular.js' },
	{ id: 4, name: 'React' }
]
```

name: Dynamic source
author: Total.js
readme: The component loads data and map them automatically.

name: Enable editing
author: Total.js
readme: This component enables editing of elements in it, under specified conditions, you can set in settings.

name: External image
author: Total.js
readme: This component renders external image from.

name: File uploader
author: Total.js
readme: The component allows users to upload files to a specific endpoint. A response will be binded to the path set in the configuration.

name: Floor plan
author: Total.js
readme: The component can be used as a background / floor plan for dynamic markers.

name: Flow Input
author: Total.js
readme: The component processes incoming data from the Total.js Flow. It can resend data to other inputs automatically.

name: Flow Output
author: Total.js
readme: The component will capture output from other outputs and send data to the Flow.

name: Form
author: Total.js
readme: The components creates a form.

name: Gap
author: Total.js
readme: This component creates a gap, according to number of pixels you set in settings.

name: GPS
author: Total.js
readme:
This component can retrieve GPS position.

__Output__:

```js
{
	lat: Number,
	lng: Number,
	speed: Number,
	altitude: Number,
	accuracy: Number,
	pos: String
}
```

name: Headline
author: Total.js
readme: This component creates headline. You can set type and style in settings.

name: Hidden container
author: Total.js
readme: This container will always be hidden in the render and it's targeted for data operations.

name: Hidden value
author: Total.js
readme: The component sets a hidden value to the model.

name: Horizontal rule
author: Total.js
readme: Horizontal rule component.

name: HTML
author: Total.js
readme: This component renders raw HTML content.

name: Icon
author: Total.js
readme: The component obtaining a list of Total.js icons and search field.

name: Image
author: Total.js
readme: This component inserts image from your device, or from specific path. Just click on the component in the editor, and insert comfortably image from your device, or set a path to your image in settings.

name: Info card
author: Total.js
readme: This component displays an information-type text. You can set your style in settings.

name: Input
author: Total.js
readme: The component processes input data and sets it according to a defined path.

name: Last value
author: Total.js
readme: This component displays text value and icon according to your styles in settings.

name: Line chart
author: Total.js
readme:
__Linechart data-source needs to contain__:

```js
[
	{
		name: 'name', // name of the serie
		data: [{ x: 'DATE', y: 'value' }, { x: 'DATE', y: 'value' }, ...], // series
		decimals: 2, // optional, number of decimal places
		unit: '°C' // optional
	}
]
```

name: Link
author: Total.js
readme: The component can load another app.

__Listbox data-source needs to contain__:

```js

	{ name: 'PHP' },
	{ name: 'node.js', description: 'Lorem ipsum' // optional },

]
```

__Listview data-source needs to contain__:

```js
[
	{ name: 'Ruby' },
	{ name: 'PHP' },
	{ name: 'Total.js', description: 'Lorem ipsum' // optional },
	{ name: 'Python' }
]
```

name: Map
author: Total.js
readme: This component displays a map, with a position, you set in settings as a map center. In settings you can change the style of this component.

name: Panel
author: Total.js
readme: The component is suitable to making a better design.

name: Paragraph
author: Total.js
readme: This component creates a paragraph element with specific style you can set in settings.

name: Part
author: Total.js
readme: The form collects only components with defined paths.

name: Part container
author: Total.js
readme: The form collects only components with defined paths.

__Piechart data-source needs to contain__:

[
	{
		data: 44,
		name: 'Apple',
		unit: '',
		decimals: 1
	},
	{
		data: 55,
		name: 'Mango',
		unit: '',
		decimals: 1
	}

author: Total.js
readme: This component will play the sound you set in your settings.

name: Progress bar
author: Total.js
readme: Progress bar is used to visualize the progression of an extended operation.

author: Total.js
readme:
__Radio button__ data-source needs to contain:

```js
[
	{ id: 1, name: 'Ruby', },
	{ id: 2, name: 'PHP', },
	{ id: 3, name: 'Node' },
	{ id: 4, name: 'Python' }
]
```

name: Rating
author: Total.js
readme: The component lets a user provide a star rating or view other people's ratings on a numeric scale for any service provided.

name: Read value
author: Total.js
readme: Read value component reads a value according to the path and sets it according to the component's path.

name: Redirect
author: Total.js
readme:
The component can redirect page by datasource. Datasource is required and needs to contain: 

```js
[
	{ id: 1, url: 'https://www.totaljs.com/' },
	{ id: 2, url: 'https://www.totaljs.com/' },
	{ id: 3, url: 'https://www.totaljs.com/' }
]
```

name: REST Reader
author: Total.js
readme: This component reads data from a REST service and sets them according to the specified path.

name: Rich text editor
author: Total.js
readme:
Usage: ripple="false"
	- Configure tis component by providing your API key, enabling plugins, and toggling autosave.
- **API Key**: You can enter your API key, which is required for using the editor.
- **Plugins**: You can select which TinyMCE plugins to enable for the editor.
- **Autosave**: You can toggle autosave functionality.

name: Scope
author: Total.js
readme: The scope component creates a scope for nested components.

name: Send to input
author: Total.js
readme: This component can send data to an input.

name: Show components
author: Total.js
readme: This component shows/hides components you put into it. You cen set your circumstances in settings of this component.

name: Slider
author: Total.js
readme: Component allows to select a single value, but highlights with a range selection from the min value to the current handle value.

name: Style box
author: Total.js
readme: This component is a content component, that displays content you put into it in editor. You can style this component in setttings.

name: Tabs
author: Total.js
readme: The component is a content panel to show multiple contents in specific space one at a time.

name: Textarea
author: Total.js
readme: The Multiline Textbox is used to edit or display multiple lines of text. You can allow resiging the height of an element.

name: Textbox
author: Total.js
readme:
A Textbox is an input element that allows to get input from the user. It allows the user either to edit or display the input values.

__Types__:

- `string`
- `number`
- `date`
- `datetime`
- `email`
- `ZIP`
- `phone number`
- `password`

name: To JSON
author: Total.js
readme: This component prints data in JSON format.

name: Toggle button
author: Total.js
readme: Button that switches between two states: `true`/`false`

name: Toggle group
author: Total.js
readme:
__Toggle group__ data-source needs to contain:

```js
[
	{ id: 1, name: 'Ruby', icon: 'ti ti-totaljs' // optional },
	{ id: 2, name: 'PHP', },
	{ id: 3, name: 'Node' },
	{ id: 4, name: 'Python' }
]
```

name: Toolbar
author: Total.js
readme: Series of buttons on a single line with headline.

name: Variable container
author: Total.js
readme: A variable container offers a user-defined maximum width.

name: Video
author: Total.js
readme: This component plays a video from a link you set in settings.

name: WebSocket receiver
author: Total.js
readme: The component creates a WebSocket connection, binds all incoming messages to the model, and sends changes over WebSocket.
